short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Quick access to your favorite URLs by using shortcuts. Use aliases instead. For example, you could type 'g' to access 'google.com'

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Create shortcuts to access your favorite websites. Don't write full URLs anymore!

Stop browsing your history to find a site, add it to Quick!Query and set a shortcut (as short as a single letter!) and save time.

How to use it:
- Open the extension 
- Add an entry by adding your shortcut and the actual web address that it will redirect to
- Click "Add"
- Head to the address bar
- Type "qq"
- Press the "SPACE bar" or "TAB"
- The Quick!Query engine will appear
- Type any of your saved shortcuts
- Hit "ENTER" and that's it!

Use cases examples:
- Work, specific JIRA boards, custom subdomains or company tools
- Education, courses, Moodle boards, school intranet, learning portals

And more at the press of a key!


IMPORTANT:
- No data is collected, transferred or shared. At all.
